baseline_groups.claim_summary: Climate damages follow a power law in temperature with exponent d2 approximately equal to 2 (quadratic damages). The meta-regression of log(damages) on log(temperature) across 43 observations from 27 climate damage studies yields a slope of approximately 1.88.
baseline_groups.notes: Table 1 baseline. Coefficient 1.882 (SE 0.451, p<0.001). N=43, R2=0.299. This is the only empirical regression in the paper; the structural model (dynamic programming for optimal carbon tax) cannot be subjected to specification search.

global_notes: Paper is 'Optimal Climate Policy When Damages Are Unknown' (AEJ Policy). The specification search covers Table 1's meta-regression only. The structural model outputs (optimal carbon taxes, welfare calculations) depend on these parameter estimates but are not varied here. The bootstrap spec (robust/se/bootstrap) has an anomalous p-value of 1.012, likely a coding issue. Leave-one-out analysis (15 specs) shows no single influential study. Strong heterogeneity by study type: market-only estimates yield d2~0 while non-market estimates yield d2~3.9.
